name: GriDice
description:
Move around the grid and attack your opponent all according to the roll of the dice.

Controls:

  • Use WASD or the Arrow keys to move.
  • Use left click or Q to attack, this will be based on the blue dice that has been rolled.
  • Use right click or E to counter, this will block an incoming attack and reroll the dice.
  • Press escape to go back to the menu - didn't have time for a pause menu sorry

This game was made for the GMTK Game Jam 2022, over the course of 50 long hours.

The theme was Roll Of The Dice, I already went into the jam wanting to make a game like One Step From Eden since I've been playing a lot of it recently and it's different from most other games I've made. 

So I went with the idea that the number you roll on the dice will determine the number of tiles on the grid that you can walk on. Meaning if you roll a 1, you can't move. 

Then I thought that was a bit plain by itself, so I added a second dice that determines where you can hit on the opponents grid. This was pretty much ripped off of One Step From Eden where you have the indicator and all of your cards are relative to that, but you have to remember in the moment what tiles that card will hit. So in this, it will roll a number and you can only hit the tiles corresponding to that number relative to your indicator.

It was a pretty hectic weekend, not great time to be making a game. I had two birthdays, and a wedding, so I'm currently back at my parents working on a bean bag chair. So I didn't have as much time as I would've liked. But I managed to make a barebones game I think (emphasis on barebones).
